site_title: The Eigen Society | Mathematics Club of IIM Sambalpur

headline: Exploring the Beauty of Mathematics Through Innovation, Collaboration, and Analytical Thinking
Transforming Mathematical Concepts into Real-World Solutions
Where Mathematical Minds Converge to Solve, Innovate, and Lead
sub_headline: Join a community of problem-solvers dedicated to advancing mathematical knowledge at IIM Sambalpur
Discover the elegance of mathematical thinking in business, technology, and beyond
homepage.lede: The Eigen Society is IIM Sambalpur's premier mathematics club fostering analytical thinking, research collaboration, and practical applications of mathematical concepts across disciplines.

feature_sections.title: Member Spotlight
feature_sections.content: Celebrating Priya Sharma's innovative application of graph theory to optimize supply chain networks, winning the National Mathematics Competition 2023.

feature_sections.title: Upcoming Events
feature_sections.content: Join us for our weekly problem-solving sessions, monthly guest lectures, and annual mathematics symposium.

feature_sections.title: Research Highlights
feature_sections.content: Explore our latest student-led research on applications of eigenvalues in data compression algorithms.

CTAs: The Eigen Society welcomes students passionate about mathematics to join our community of problem-solvers. Gain access to exclusive workshops, research opportunities, mentorship from faculty experts, and a network of like-minded peers. Take your mathematical journey to the next level with us.

about.mission: The Eigen Society aims to foster mathematical excellence through collaborative learning, research, and practical applications, creating a vibrant community that bridges theoretical concepts with real-world challenges.
about.vision: To be recognized as a leading student mathematics society that empowers members to become innovative problem-solvers and thought leaders in their fields, while advancing mathematical knowledge and its applications.

values.title: Intellectual Curiosity
values.description: We encourage continuous questioning and exploration of mathematical concepts.

values.title: Collaborative Learning
values.description: We believe in the power of diverse perspectives in problem-solving.

values.title: Analytical Rigor
values.description: We uphold high standards of mathematical precision and logical thinking.

values.title: Practical Application
values.description: We bridge theoretical mathematics with real-world challenges.

values.title: Inclusive Excellence
values.description: We welcome and support all students interested in mathematics, regardless of background.

about.history: Founded in 2018 by a group of passionate mathematics students at IIM Sambalpur, The Eigen Society began as an informal study group and has evolved into a structured organization with over 150 members. Named after the fundamental concept of eigenvalues in linear algebra, our society has established annual competitions, a peer-reviewed journal, and partnerships with industry leaders and academic institutions across India.

criteria.title: Academic Eligibility
requirements: Successful completion of at least one mathematics course at IIM Sambalpur
Recommendation from a faculty member (for Research Membership tier)

criteria.title: Member Commitments
requirements: Attend at least 3 events per semester
Participate in at least 1 problem-solving workshop annually
Contribute to society activities (event organization, research, or outreach)
Uphold the society's code of conduct and values

tiers.name: Basic (Student)
benefits: Access to all regular events and workshops
Access to society resources and problem sets
Networking opportunities with peers and faculty

tiers.name: Research Member
benefits: Eligibility to publish in the society journal
Access to research grants and travel funding

tiers.name: Alumni / Lifetime
benefits: Invitation to special events and reunions

tiers.name: Faculty Advisor
benefits: Access to student talent for research assistance
Access to exclusive workshops and seminars
Networking with faculty and industry professionals
Opportunities to present and publish research
Access to problem sets and learning resources
Participation in national and international competitions

join_flow.description: Complete the online membership application form with your academic information and interest in mathematics.
form_fields: Faculty Reference (if applying for Research Membership)

join_flow.description: Applications are reviewed by the membership committee within 7 days.
Upon approval, complete the membership fee payment through the online portal or at the society office.
Receive your membership confirmation email and welcome package.
join_flow.email_template:
Dear [Name],

Congratulations! We are delighted to welcome you as a [Membership Tier] member of The Eigen Society at IIM Sambalpur.

Your membership is now active and valid until [End Date]. Your membership ID is [ID].

As a member, you now have access to:
- Our upcoming events and workshops
- The members-only section of our website
- Our problem-solving resources and research materials
- Networking opportunities with peers and faculty

Our next event is [Event Name] on [Date] at [Time], [Location]. We hope to see you there!

Please join our WhatsApp group using this link: [Link] and follow us on social media to stay updated.

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us at eigen.society@iimsambalpurstudent.ac.in.

Welcome to the mathematical community!

Warm regards,
[President Name]
President, The Eigen Society
IIM Sambalpur

join_flow.description: Attend the new member orientation session to learn about society activities and meet other members.

membership.consent_text: By submitting this form, I consent to The Eigen Society collecting and processing my personal information for the purpose of membership administration. This information will be used to communicate with me about society activities, process my membership, and maintain records as required. I understand that my information will not be shared with third parties without my consent, except as required by law. I can withdraw my consent at any time by contacting the society. For more information on how we handle your data, please see our Privacy Policy.

event_types.description: Collaborative sessions where members tackle challenging mathematical problems across various domains.

event_types.frequency: First Friday of each month, 4:00-5:30 PM
event_types.description: Talks by faculty, industry professionals, and visiting academics on mathematical topics and applications.
Hands-on workshops focusing on research methodologies, tools, and current trends in mathematical research.
A three-day event featuring presentations, competitions, and networking opportunities with mathematicians from across India.
Interactive sessions with industry professionals showcasing real-world applications of mathematics in business and technology.

sample_event_page.title: Eigenvalues and Their Applications in Machine Learning
sample_event_page.location: Lecture Hall 3, Academic Block, IIM Sambalpur
sample_event_page.abstract: This lecture explores the fundamental role of eigenvalues and eigenvectors in machine learning algorithms, particularly in dimensionality reduction techniques like Principal Component Analysis (PCA). We will discuss how these mathematical concepts enable efficient data processing and feature extraction, with practical examples from image recognition and natural language processing applications. The session will include both theoretical foundations and coding demonstrations using Python and NumPy.

speaker.name: Dr. Priya Sharma
speaker.title: Associate Professor, Department of Mathematics, IIT Bombay
speaker.bio: Dr. Sharma specializes in linear algebra and its applications in machine learning. With over 15 years of research experience and numerous publications in top-tier journals, she bridges theoretical mathematics with practical applications. Prior to her academic career, she worked as a data scientist at Microsoft Research, developing algorithms for computer vision applications.
speaker.photo_alt: Headshot of Dr. Priya Sharma smiling in professional attire against a neutral background

agenda: 4:10 - 4:40 PM: Lecture on eigenvalues in machine learning
4:40 - 5:00 PM: Practical demonstrations and code examples
sample_event_page.prerequisites: Basic understanding of linear algebra and familiarity with Python programming. Recommended for students who have completed at least one course in mathematics or computer science.
sample_event_page.materials: Participants are encouraged to bring laptops for the coding demonstration portion. Slides and code samples will be shared after the event.

fields: Are you a member of The Eigen Society? (Yes/No)
Do you plan to attend in-person or virtually?
Any specific questions for the speaker?

sample_event_page.promo_copy: Don't miss this opportunity to learn how eigenvaluesâ€”a fundamental concept in linear algebraâ€”power some of today's most innovative machine learning algorithms. Dr. Priya Sharma, a leading expert in the field, will break down complex mathematical concepts into accessible insights with real-world applications. Whether you're a mathematics enthusiast, a computer science student, or simply curious about how math drives AI, this session will expand your understanding and inspire new connections. Limited seats available for in-person attendanceâ€”register now!

events: New Member Recruitment Drive (First two weeks)
Orientation Session for New Members (Third week)
Research Workshop: Literature Review Methods (September, third weekend)
Industry Connect: Mathematics in Finance (October, second week)
Research Workshop: Data Analysis Tools (November, third weekend)
Holiday Mathematical Game Night (Last week before break)

Industry Connect: Mathematics in Technology (January, third week)
Elections for Next Year's Leadership (Second week)

competitions.name: Eigen Challenge
competitions.description: A rigorous problem-solving competition testing mathematical creativity and analytical skills across algebra, calculus, statistics, and discrete mathematics.
competitions.eligibility: All undergraduate and postgraduate students from IIM Sambalpur and invited institutions
competitions.prizes: Cash prizes totaling â‚¹25,000, certificates, and recognition at the Annual Symposium

competitions.name: Mathematical Modeling Contest
competitions.description: Teams tackle real-world problems using mathematical modeling techniques, with cases drawn from business, environmental science, and public policy.
competitions.eligibility: Teams of 2-3 students, at least one member must be from IIM Sambalpur
competitions.prizes: â‚¹15,000 for winning team, industry mentorship opportunities, and publication in the society journal

competitions.name: Rapid Fire Mathematics Quiz
competitions.description: Fast-paced quiz testing mathematical knowledge, history, and applications with individual and team rounds.
competitions.eligibility: Open to all IIM Sambalpur students
competitions.prizes: Gift vouchers, mathematics books, and society merchandise

competitions.name: Research Paper Competition
competitions.description: Competition for original research papers in pure and applied mathematics, with emphasis on innovation and practical applications.
competitions.eligibility: Undergraduate and postgraduate students, individual or team submissions
competitions.prizes: Publication in society journal, â‚¹20,000 prize, and opportunity to present at the Annual Symposium

workshops.name: Mathematical Software Workshop Series
workshops.description: Hands-on training in essential mathematical software including MATLAB, R, Python for data analysis, and LaTeX for mathematical writing.

workshops.name: Research Methodology Workshop
workshops.description: Comprehensive training on conducting mathematical research, from problem formulation to literature review, methodology selection, and paper writing.

workshops.name: Mathematical Applications in Business
workshops.description: Workshops connecting mathematical concepts to business applications including optimization, forecasting, risk analysis, and decision theory.

workshops.name: Competitive Problem-Solving Bootcamp
workshops.description: Intensive training for mathematics competitions, covering problem-solving strategies, common techniques, and practice with past competition problems.
workshops.format: Weekend bootcamp with team and individual practice

mentorship.name: Faculty-Student Research Partnerships
mentorship.description: Matching students with faculty mentors for collaborative research projects in mathematics and its applications.
mentorship.outcomes: Joint research papers, conference presentations, and skill development

mentorship.name: Peer Mentoring Program
mentorship.description: Pairing experienced society members with newcomers to provide guidance on academic pathways, research opportunities, and society involvement.
mentorship.structure: Bi-weekly meetings throughout the academic year
mentorship.outcomes: Improved retention, academic performance, and society engagement

mentorship.name: Industry Mentorship
mentorship.description: Connecting students with mathematics professionals in industry for career guidance and applied project mentorship.
mentorship.structure: Monthly virtual meetings and quarterly in-person sessions
mentorship.outcomes: Internship opportunities, career guidance, and applied project experience

mentorship.name: Research Group Mentorship
mentorship.description: Small groups of students working on related research topics under the guidance of a faculty mentor or senior researcher.
mentorship.structure: Weekly group meetings and collaborative research activities
mentorship.outcomes: Collaborative publications, conference presentations, and specialized skill development

journal_or_blog.title: Eigenvalues: The Journal of Mathematical Research at IIM Sambalpur
journal_or_blog.description: A peer-reviewed journal showcasing original mathematical research by undergraduate and postgraduate students, with a focus on innovative applications and interdisciplinary approaches.
journal_or_blog.scope: The journal publishes research articles, review papers, and expository works in pure and applied mathematics, with special emphasis on business applications, data science, computational methods, and interdisciplinary research.

submission_guidelines.format: Manuscripts should be submitted in LaTeX format using the journal template available on our website. Length should be between 3,000-8,000 words including references.
submission_guidelines.structure: Papers should include an abstract (150-250 words), keywords, introduction, methodology, results, discussion, conclusion, and references in APA format.
submission_guidelines.originality: All submissions must be original work not previously published or under consideration elsewhere.
submission_guidelines.author_information: Include names, affiliations, and contact information for all authors, with a designated corresponding author.

journal_or_blog.editorial_policy: All submissions undergo initial screening by the editorial board followed by double-blind peer review by at least two reviewers. Authors may be asked to revise their manuscripts based on reviewer feedback. The editorial board makes final decisions on acceptance.
journal_or_blog.peer_review: Each submission is reviewed by at least one faculty member and one senior student researcher. Reviewers evaluate originality, mathematical rigor, clarity, and significance of the work.
journal_or_blog.open_access: Eigenvalues is an open-access publication available to all readers online. Authors retain copyright of their work under a Creative Commons Attribution License (CC BY).

press_spotlight.title: IIM Sambalpur's Eigen Society Hosts National Mathematics Symposium
press_spotlight.content: The Eigen Society at IIM Sambalpur successfully organized its third Annual Mathematics Symposium, bringing together over 200 participants from 25 institutions across India. The three-day event featured keynote speeches from renowned mathematicians, student research presentations, and interactive workshops on emerging mathematical applications in business and technology.
press_spotlight.publication: For press release to local and national educational publications

press_spotlight.title: Eigen Society Members Win Top Honors at Inter-IIM Mathematical Modeling Competition
press_spotlight.content: A team of three students from IIM Sambalpur's Eigen Society secured first place at the prestigious Inter-IIM Mathematical Modeling Competition held at IIM Ahmedabad. Their innovative solution to optimize urban transportation networks using graph theory and linear programming impressed the judges, earning them the championship trophy and a cash prize of â‚¹50,000.
press_spotlight.publication: For institute website and alumni newsletter

press_spotlight.title: Mathematical Research Journal Launched by IIM Sambalpur Students
press_spotlight.content: The Eigen Society at IIM Sambalpur has launched 'Eigenvalues,' a peer-reviewed journal dedicated to undergraduate and postgraduate mathematical research. The bi-annual publication aims to provide students with a platform to showcase original research, with a special focus on applications of mathematics in business and management contexts.

awards_and_grants.chapter_grants: The Eigen Society offers Chapter Activity Grants to support innovative mathematical initiatives within the society. Grants ranging from â‚¹5,000 to â‚¹20,000 are available for projects that enhance mathematical learning, research, or outreach. Proposals are evaluated based on innovation, impact, feasibility, and alignment with society goals. Applications are accepted twice yearly (July and December) with decisions announced within one month.

student_awards.name: Outstanding Mathematical Research Award
student_awards.description: Recognizes exceptional original research conducted by student members.
student_awards.eligibility: Current society members who have completed a research project within the past academic year.
student_awards.prize: â‚¹10,000, certificate, and publication support in the society journal.
student_awards.application: Submission of research paper, faculty recommendation, and research impact statement.

student_awards.name: Mathematical Excellence Scholarship
student_awards.description: Supports academically outstanding students with demonstrated financial need.
student_awards.eligibility: Society members with CGPA above 8.5/10 and documented financial need.
student_awards.prize: â‚¹15,000 scholarship and mentorship from faculty advisor.
student_awards.application: Academic transcripts, personal statement, and financial documentation.

student_awards.name: Conference Travel Grant
student_awards.description: Supports students presenting mathematical research at national or international conferences.
student_awards.eligibility: Society members with accepted conference presentations.
student_awards.prize: Up to â‚¹25,000 for travel, accommodation, and registration expenses.
student_awards.application: Conference acceptance letter, abstract, budget proposal, and faculty endorsement.

student_awards.name: Community Mathematics Outreach Award
student_awards.description: Recognizes innovative efforts to promote mathematics in the wider community.
student_awards.eligibility: Individual members or teams who have conducted mathematics outreach activities.
student_awards.prize: â‚¹7,500, certificate, and feature in society publications.
student_awards.application: Project report, impact assessment, and testimonials from beneficiaries.

governance.structure: The Eigen Society operates under a democratic governance structure with elected student leaders and faculty advisors. The Executive Committee oversees all society activities and is elected annually by the general membership. Committee members serve one-year terms (May to April) with a maximum of two consecutive terms in the same position. The society also maintains specialized committees for specific functions such as events, research, and outreach.

roles.title: President
responsibilities: Overall leadership and strategic direction of the society
Representing the society in official capacities
Coordinating with faculty advisors and institute administration
roles.eligibility: Must have been an active member for at least one year

roles.title: Vice President/Events Coordinator
responsibilities: Planning and execution of all society events
Deputizing for the President when required
roles.eligibility: Must have been an active member for at least one semester

roles.title: Treasurer
responsibilities: Processing membership fees and expense reimbursements
Ensuring compliance with institute financial policies
roles.eligibility: Must have been an active member for at least one semester

roles.title: Communications Officer
responsibilities: Managing society website and social media
Creating and distributing newsletters and announcements

roles.title: Research Coordinator
responsibilities: Overseeing research initiatives and mentorship programs
Managing the society journal and publications
Coordinating with faculty on research opportunities
roles.eligibility: Must have research experience or be a Research Member

roles.title: Student Representatives (2 positions)
responsibilities: Assisting with member recruitment and engagement
Supporting other Executive Committee members as needed
roles.eligibility: Open to all members, with one position reserved for first-year students

roles.title: Faculty Advisor
responsibilities: Advising on society initiatives and strategic direction
Facilitating connections with other faculty and departments
Supporting grant applications and institutional approvals
roles.eligibility: Faculty member at IIM Sambalpur with interest in mathematics

governance.sample_bylaws_summary:
The Eigen Society operates according to a set of bylaws that govern its activities, membership, and governance. Key provisions include:

1. Membership: Open to all IIM Sambalpur students meeting academic criteria, with different tiers and associated benefits.

2. Governance: Democratic election of Executive Committee annually, with specific roles and responsibilities outlined for each position.

3. Meetings: General body meetings held monthly during the academic year, with Executive Committee meetings held bi-weekly.

4. Elections: Conducted in April each year, with nominations, campaigning, and voting procedures specified.

5. Finances: Membership fees and other funds managed transparently, with annual budgeting and reporting requirements.

6. Activities: Core activities include events, research, publications, competitions, and outreach, with committees established for each area.

7. Amendments: Bylaws may be amended by two-thirds majority vote of the general membership after review by the Executive Committee.

8. Code of Conduct: Members must adhere to academic integrity, respectful communication, and collaborative principles.

9. Dissolution: Procedures for society dissolution and asset distribution in the unlikely event it becomes necessary.

10. Transition: Guidelines for leadership transition and knowledge transfer between outgoing and incoming officers.

teaching_materials.title: Linear Algebra Fundamentals
teaching_materials.description: Comprehensive notes on vector spaces, linear transformations, eigenvalues, and eigenvectors with applications.
teaching_materials.format: PDF lecture notes and practice problems

teaching_materials.title: Probability and Statistics for Data Analysis
teaching_materials.description: Materials covering probability distributions, hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and Bayesian methods.
teaching_materials.format: Slide decks, R code examples, and datasets

teaching_materials.title: Optimization Techniques in Business
teaching_materials.description: Case studies and tutorials on linear programming, integer programming, and nonlinear optimization for business applications.
teaching_materials.format: Case studies, Excel templates, and Python notebooks

teaching_materials.title: Mathematical Modeling Workshop Materials
teaching_materials.description: Step-by-step guides for developing mathematical models for real-world problems, with examples from various domains.
teaching_materials.format: Workshop handouts, templates, and example models

problem_sets.title: Weekly Challenge Problems
problem_sets.description: Curated sets of challenging problems across various mathematical domains, updated weekly.
problem_sets.topics: Algebra, calculus, discrete mathematics, probability, and more

problem_sets.title: Competition Preparation Problem Sets
problem_sets.description: Problems from past mathematics competitions with solutions and strategy discussions.

problem_sets.title: Applied Mathematics Case Problems
problem_sets.description: Real-world scenarios requiring mathematical modeling and problem-solving approaches.
problem_sets.topics: Operations research, financial mathematics, data analysis, optimization

problem_sets.title: Collaborative Research Problems
problem_sets.description: Open-ended research questions suitable for group exploration and extended projects.
problem_sets.topics: Current research areas with potential for original contributions

email_templates.subject: Welcome to The Eigen Society at IIM Sambalpur!
email_templates.body:
Dear [Name],

Congratulations and welcome to The Eigen Society, IIM Sambalpur's premier mathematics club! We're thrilled to have you join our community of mathematical thinkers and problem-solvers.

Your membership is now active, and your Member ID is [ID]. Here's what you need to know to get started:

ðŸ”¹ MEMBER PORTAL
Log in at [URL] using your student email. Your temporary password is [password]. Please change it upon first login.

ðŸ”¹ UPCOMING EVENTS
Our next event is [Event Name] on [Date] at [Time] in [Location]. We recommend adding our shared calendar to your schedule: [Calendar Link]

ðŸ”¹ GET INVOLVED
- Join our WhatsApp group: [Link]
- Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn: @EigenSocietyIIM
- Attend our New Member Orientation on [Date] at [Time]

ðŸ”¹ RESOURCES
As a member, you now have access to:
- Our problem sets library
- Past competition papers
- Research mentorship opportunities
- Society journal archives

ðŸ”¹ YOUR MEMBERSHIP BENEFITS
As a [Membership Tier] member, you're entitled to [specific benefits based on tier].

If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact me or any member of our Executive Committee.

We look forward to seeing you at our next event!

Warm regards,

[Name]
President
The Eigen Society
IIM Sambalpur
[Contact Information]

[Brief description of the event, speaker information, etc.]

ðŸ”¹ PREPARATION
[Any materials to review, software to install, or items to bring]

ðŸ”¹ LOGISTICS
- For in-person attendees: [Parking information, room location, etc.]
- For online attendees: [Link, password, technical requirements]

If you can no longer attend, please let us know by replying to this email so we can offer your spot to someone on the waitlist.

We look forward to seeing you tomorrow!

Best regards,

[Name]
Events Coordinator
The Eigen Society
IIM Sambalpur

email_templates.subject: Your Eigen Society Membership - Renewal Information
email_templates.body:
Dear [Name],

Your membership with The Eigen Society will be expiring on [Date]. We've enjoyed having you as part of our mathematical community this past year and hope you'll continue your journey with us.

ðŸ”¹ YOUR IMPACT THIS YEAR
As a member, you've been part of:
- [Number] events and workshops
- Our [specific achievement] that won [award/recognition]
- A community of [number] mathematics enthusiasts

ðŸ”¹ RENEWAL OPTIONS
To continue your membership, please choose one of the following options:

1. RENEW ONLINE: Visit [URL] and log in with your credentials
2. IN-PERSON: Visit our office in [Location] during office hours (Mon-Fri, 2-5 PM)
3. AUTOMATIC RENEWAL: If you selected this option last year, no action is needed

The renewal fee for [Membership Tier] is â‚¹[Amount] for the academic year [Year-Year].

ðŸ”¹ UPGRADE OPPORTUNITY
Consider upgrading to [Higher Tier] membership to access additional benefits including [specific benefits of higher tier]. The upgrade cost is an additional â‚¹[Amount].

ðŸ”¹ WHAT'S NEW NEXT YEAR
We're excited to announce several new initiatives for the upcoming year:
- [New program/event/benefit 1]
- [New program/event/benefit 2]
- [New program/event/benefit 3]

If you have any questions about renewal or would like to discuss your membership options, please contact our Membership Coordinator at [Email].

Thank you for being part of The Eigen Society. We hope to continue exploring the world of mathematics with you!

Warm regards,

[Name]
Membership Coordinator
The Eigen Society
IIM Sambalpur

site_snippets.contact_block:
## Contact The Eigen Society

We'd love to hear from you! Whether you have questions about membership, events, or collaboration opportunities, our team is here to help.

**Email:** eigen.society@iimsambalpurstudent.ac.in

**Office:** Room 105, Student Activities Center, IIM Sambalpur Campus

**Office Hours:** Monday-Friday, 2:00-5:00 PM (during academic sessions)

**Social Media:** @EigenSocietyIIM on Instagram, LinkedIn, and X

For specific inquiries, please contact:
- **Membership:** membership.eigen@iimsambalpurstudent.ac.in
- **Events:** events.eigen@iimsambalpurstudent.ac.in
- **Research:** research.eigen@iimsambalpurstudent.ac.in
- **Media:** media.eigen@iimsambalpurstudent.ac.in
site_snippets.donate_block:
## Support Mathematical Excellence

Your contribution helps us foster mathematical talent and innovation at IIM Sambalpur. Donations to The Eigen Society support:

- Student research grants
- Conference travel for presenting research
- Bringing distinguished speakers to campus
- Competition prizes and awards
- Community outreach programs

**How to Donate:**
- Online: [Donation Portal Link]
- Bank Transfer: [Account Details]
- In-person: Visit our office during working hours

All donations above â‚¹500 receive a certificate of appreciation and recognition on our website (unless anonymity is requested).

For corporate sponsorship opportunities, please contact our Treasurer at treasurer.eigen@iimsambalpurstudent.ac.in.
site_snippets.volunteer_block:
## Get Involved with The Eigen Society

We welcome volunteers who are passionate about mathematics and want to contribute to our community. Volunteering opportunities include:

- Event organization and logistics
- Mentoring junior members
- Content creation for our website and social media
- Outreach to local schools and colleges
- Assisting with the annual symposium

**Benefits of Volunteering:**
- Develop leadership and organizational skills
- Network with faculty and industry professionals
- Receive recognition on our website and in our newsletter
- Letter of recommendation for outstanding volunteers

To express interest in volunteering, please complete our volunteer form: [Form Link] or email volunteer.eigen@iimsambalpurstudent.ac.in with your areas of interest.

image_suggestions.description: A modern, minimalist logo featuring the Greek letter lambda (Î») integrated with an eigenvalue matrix representation, using purple and blue gradient colors.
image_suggestions.alt_text: The Eigen Society logo featuring the lambda symbol and eigenvalue matrix representation

image_suggestions.description: Abstract visualization of mathematical concepts like eigenvalues, vectors, and matrices, with floating 3D geometric shapes against a gradient background that transitions from deep purple to blue.
image_suggestions.alt_text: Abstract 3D visualization of mathematical concepts including eigenvalues and matrices

image_suggestions.description: Group photo of diverse society members collaborating on a mathematical problem at a whiteboard or during an event, showing engagement and teamwork.
image_suggestions.alt_text: Diverse members of The Eigen Society collaborating on mathematical problems

image_suggestions.description: Dynamic image of a workshop or symposium in progress, showing speakers and engaged audience members in the IIM Sambalpur lecture hall.
image_suggestions.alt_text: The Eigen Society workshop in progress at IIM Sambalpur lecture hall

image_suggestions.description: Split image showing both theoretical mathematics (equations on a board/paper) and practical applications (data visualization, business analytics dashboard, or real-world problem-solving).
image_suggestions.alt_text: Mathematical theory and practical applications side by side, representing The Eigen Society's research focus

image_suggestions.description: Series of cards representing different membership tiers, each with a unique mathematical concept visualization (e.g., vectors for Basic, matrices for Research, networks for Alumni).
image_suggestions.alt_text: Membership tier cards with mathematical concept visualizations for The Eigen Society

image_suggestions.description: Square format image featuring the society logo centered on a gradient background with subtle mathematical equations or symbols as a pattern overlay.
image_suggestions.alt_text: The Eigen Society logo on a mathematical pattern background

image_suggestions.description: Set of consistent, minimalist icons representing different sections: calculator for resources, trophy for competitions, calendar for events, document for journal, etc.
image_suggestions.alt_text: Icon set for The Eigen Society website sections

accessibility_note: The Eigen Society is committed to making mathematics accessible to all. Our website adheres to WCAG 2.1 AA standards, ensuring content is perceivable, operable, understandable, and robust for users with diverse abilities. We provide alternative text for images, ensure sufficient color contrast, maintain keyboard navigability, and use clear, consistent navigation. If you encounter accessibility barriers or need materials in alternative formats, please contact us at accessibility.eigen@iimsambalpurstudent.ac.in.
